column4: Hello is there a bandwidth monitoring program for ubuntu like bitmeter http://codebox.org.uk/controller?page=bitmeter2   I want to monitor the network traffic at all times, probably the app sitting at a corner. Thanks.
conky or gkrellm have real time network monitors (there are probably many more)
never hard about them, i will try them now, thanks
I installed conky through synaptic. Conky is not present in Applications menu anywhere. How can I run the app?
try running it from a terminal -- FYI i don't use conky

about conky, its not present in edit menus. I tried running "conky" in terminal, it prints three lines, the last one being "Conky: drawing to single buffer". The process still running. Thanks, still finding other ways.
sorry man i don't use conky so i have no idea
oh hey! it runs, alt f2 conky, thank you very much!! weird what hapenned when terminal. anyway thanks once again
see http://paste.ubuntu.com/345469/ for nvidia settings fix
sorry use http://paste.ubuntu.com/345474/ instead xorg.conf.backup can cause problems
i tried both, but it says the file doesnt exist, http://pastebin.com/m9131a8a
you need to use "sudo nvidia-xconfig"
also skip the "sudo mv xorg.conf xorg.conf.old" if you don't have an xorg.conf right now
oh thats what Flare183 was saying?, ok will try that now
thanks it saved. http://pastebin.com/m7a0ebdf4 just for understanding, in that text which one depicts the screen resoution? because I set it to 1152X... but those numbers arent present there
screen resolution isn't in "your" xorg - did you save the changes after making the change?  Screen res is typically in the "Screen" section

yes that text file was the result of the commands you gave. now in nvidia when I try to save the setting it gives me preview of sorg.conf which contains 1152X... , but nvidia cant save it, No i am in a position with the text it hand but cant save it to it.
are you using "sudo nvidia-settings" you need to in order to save changes
wow! thats done clean and perfect, thanks once again. so edits need to be done as super user. is there a mnnual where we can get the commands like "nvidia-settings"
don't know of any Super manual sorry....  learn on a case by case basis i'm affraid
thank you very much, the support here at irc is encouraging me to learn more of ubuntu, Good day.
